instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-01041: What is 820-01041? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01041</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Missing component 2018 Touch Bar
threads.message:
Greetings

Can someone please tell me what this component is or used to be?
Been searching for BRD and schematics but can't find literally everywhere.
Its on the underside of the display connector.

Will be super happy if someone could help out

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01041</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Missing component 2018 Touch Bar
threads.message: Looks like there is a fuse. I dont have schematics, but I have a board at hand.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01041</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Missing component 2018 Touch Bar
threads.message:
Looks like coil, could be replaced with a tiny wire.
But first check for short to ground on both pads; or low value maybe.
If is liquid damage, don't expect to much...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01041</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Missing component 2018 Touch Bar
threads.message: Probably a filter for the camera or image. Def check for short on both pads before soldering anything
